comments.value:
Dear Customer,

With regards to the above outstanding trouble ticket, we are currently awaiting confirmation from yourself that the issue has been cleared.

======================================

An issue regarding the host olympic-web03 was first brought to our attention by an alert for higher than usual load on the host. An attempt was made to restart the web server on the host to alleviate this load, however we were initially unable to bring up the web server instance responsible for accepting requests for the URL https://www.london2012.com due to a requirement for an SSL passphrase. The issue was escalated internally at IPsoft, after which the passphrase was determined and fed into the web server to bring the web instance for https://www.london2012.com up on the host.

For the entire duration of the issue, five other hosts (olympic-web01, olympic-web02, olympic-web04, olympic-web05, olympic-web06) were accepting traffic for the URL https://www.london2012.com . At no time for the duration of the issue was access to https://www.london2012.com impacted. All six hosts have been accepting traffic for that URL since Sunday, October 17th 11:00AM GMT.

======================================
Kindly check and confirm us the closure.


The trouble ticket will be closed if no response is received within 3 days.

If you require any further assistance, please contact the Service Desk on 0800 731 1713 or via email to ah.support@bt.com

Regards,
BT Data Centre Services | 0800 731 1713 | ah.support@bt.com | https://www.selfcare.bt.com

comments.value:
Hello

Just to confirm the details for tomorrow's splash page go-live:

The page should go live at 11.30am tomorrow but not before. I know you can't time to a minute when a page publishes and replicates across the servers, so can you work on the principle of getting the page live at 11.30am or as soon as possible after that, but no earlier, as the Ticketing site managed by Ticketmaster won't be live until 11.30am.

If anything goes wrong e.g. the press conference is late starting, I will let you know asap.

Many thanks for your work on this!

Morag

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Kindest Regards

Jagdeep Singh Bhambra

Hi Dom

These are the main areas on the site (that I can think of, *this may not be an exhaustive list*) where users POST form data.

Hope this helps, let me know if there is any other information you need.

Jamie

1) Registration (all in /settings)

	a) signup : /settings/login.php
	b) register : /settings/register.php
	c) reset password: /settings/reset-password.php
	d) set password: /settings/authenticate.php
	e) change password : /settings/password.php
	f) edit profile: /settings/edit-profile.php
	g) unsubscribe : /settings/unsubscribe.php

2) Search

	a) main search : /search.php
	b) blog search: /blog/search.php
	c) image search: /image/search.php
	d) video search: /videos/search.php
	e) event search: /get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php

3) User image upload 

     /photos/upload.php

     $allowedFiletypes = 'jpg jpeg pjpeg png x-png gif';
     $max_filesize = 1048576; #bytes

4) Map search

	/map.php

5) Blog and Photo commenting

	/php/post-comment.php

6) Photo rating

	/photos/includes/rate.php



Jamie

From Kieran: "Almost of all of what they require could be provided by one of these mailing-list managers but there is one key piece of functionality I was hoping for - the ability to authenticate users against their mailing list account. i.e. when you subscribe to a mailing list, you supply a password, which you can subsequently use to log in to the MND website (we would implement this by doing a remote authentication call to the mailing-list api).

From Jamie: "Recently we have recommended http://www.mailchimp.com or http://www.campaignmonitor.com/"

(note: this is lower priority than currently open 2012 tickets and checking Liberty on Pivotal)
ok. Closing.

comments.value: On the videos hub page I just tried to 'Search by date' - this produces no results, either on 'Past month' or 'Past year'. Please can you investigate?
Confirmed. Marked as high.

It is because the default text "Search" gets added to the querystring.
  http://www.london2012.com/videos/search.php?x=24&y=9
works fine but
  http://www.london2012.com/videos/search.php?q=Search&x=24&y=9
doesn't.
We will need to make a small amendment the Search results template.
Technically, we should push this through the (not-yet-existent) change control procedure.
I'm not 100% sure of the rules but ... with your permission, I it might be ok to publish this (relatively minor) fix to a (relatively annoying) bug.
(I stress, I'm not sure of the rules here though so I don't want this to be interpreted as an attempt to circumvent the well-intended change-control procedure!).

Sigh. It’s exactly this kind of small but untidy bug which is going to suffer under our new change request process.

Can I think about this?
Of course.

Hey Lars.
Fwding this to you.
It's a simple fix, but you're not allowed to deploy it!
Can you fix it on dev please?
NB I've got dev publishing to the staging server at the moment, so when you make your changes (and publish them) they'll be visible here:
  http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/

Any questions, just ask.

lars to fix, on dev.
morag/other to preview, double-check that fix is ok.
someone to decide whether BT need to test on staging server.
change to be applied to live cms / live website
0.5 days

Came across a second problem which was the form age dropdown itself!

Fixed, please check and comfirm: http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/videos/
Time spent: 0.3 

Lars
Hmm, ‘past year’ search works, but not ‘past month’?

Its just there are no Video uploads in the last month ( maybe that is because of dev ) ~ The last
ones showing are from July. I reckon it should work though.

Oh, okay.

I should create a Change Request form before we push this live.

Will do so now and let you know when we can publish.

Thanks!
Great!
Change requested logged – please proceed to roll out.
Rolled out, alive and tested.
Looks great – thank you very much

================================================================



We will inform you once further updates are available.

Regards,

comments.value:
Hi

Below is the process outlined with regards to the code change needed for the inclusion of Chartbeat into the main website.  This is to ensure we an audit trail, a communication channel to all relevant (and/or impacted) parties, and to ensure there is a contingency/rollback process in place.

Inclusion of Chartbeat involves a code change to the Live environment - hence this should come under change management.  As this process has yet to be formalised, the steps would be:
a) Kitsite make the code change on Staging
b) Kitsite (and LOCOG) check this to ensure the code has not broken anything - New Media to confirm
c) As Staging is a restricted environment and may not be accessible to Chartbeat*
d) Assuming the code is fine, and we have confirmation, KitSite and/or LOCOG propose a time/date to deploy tested code on Live
e) Email goes out to all concerned informing them of the change (including time/date)** - see below
f) If there are no concerns, or all concerns are addressed, then the code can be deployed at the suggested time/date
g) After deployment, KitSite performs a check on the site, and sends out an email confirming the status - eg, "Deployment successful"
h) Chartbeat is checked to see if stats can be reported - New Media/ITS to confirm

*Cannot say as I do not know how the code in Chartbeat works. Assuming the Google Analytics model as a hypothesis, then only stats from a specified URL or domain or IP would be recorded by Chartbeat

**Rollback process will need to be mentioned - in case the code in Live performs in an unexpected fashion
